intro: Homalium macropterum, commonly known as the large-winged evergreen. It is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae, native to tropical regions of South America. The plant is characterized by its broad, glossy leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It typically grows as a tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its role in local ecosystems.
